page.title: 08POINT-TO-POINT RACES
page.content: The Cumberland Farmers Foxhounds Point-to-Point is held annually at Holme Hill Parks, about one mile south east of Dalston, on the first Saturday in March. Each year about 200 horses come to participate from all over northern England and southern Scotland. These horses are almost all thoroughbred and have hunted with one of the region's many foxhound packs. The course is a large circuit over park and pasture land, with sixteen birch_stick fences over two laps of the course. The main attraction of the day is the eight races; however, there are several stalls, including saddlers, refreshments and gifts. The grass bank overlooking the course is usually crowded with cheering spectators who enjoy an odd gamble on the horses.
